description: Copies a manual snapshot of an instance or disk as another manual snapshot, or copies an automatic snapshot of an instance or disk as a manual snapshot. This operation can also be used to copy a manual or automatic snapshot of an instance or a disk from one Amazon Web Services Region to another in Amazon Lightsail. When copying a manual snapshot, be sure to define the source region, source snapshot name, and target snapshot name parameters. When copying an automatic snapshot, be sure to define the source region, source resource name, target snapshot name, and either the restore date or the use latest restorable auto snapshot parameters.

parameters.name: sourceSnapshotName
parameters.description: The name of the source manual snapshot to copy. Constraint: Define this parameter only when copying a manual snapshot as another manual snapshot.

parameters.name: sourceResourceName
parameters.description: The name of the source instance or disk from which the source automatic snapshot was created. Constraint: Define this parameter only when copying an automatic snapshot as a manual snapshot. For more information, see the Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide.

parameters.name: restoreDate
parameters.description: The date of the source automatic snapshot to copy. Use the get auto snapshots operation to identify the dates of the available automatic snapshots. Constraints: Must be specified in YYYY-MM-DD format. This parameter cannot be defined together with the use latest restorable auto snapshot parameter. The restore date and use latest restorable auto snapshot parameters are mutually exclusive. Define this parameter only when copying an automatic snapshot as a manual snapshot. For more information, see the Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide.

parameters.name: useLatestRestorableAutoSnapshot
parameters.description: A Boolean value to indicate whether to use the latest available automatic snapshot of the specified source instance or disk. Constraints: This parameter cannot be defined together with the restore date parameter. The use latest restorable auto snapshot and restore date parameters are mutually exclusive. Define this parameter only when copying an automatic snapshot as a manual snapshot. For more information, see the Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide.

parameters.name: targetSnapshotName
parameters.description: The name of the new manual snapshot to be created as a copy.

parameters.name: sourceRegion
parameters.description: The Amazon Web Services Region where the source manual or automatic snapshot is located.

nested_items.name: operations
nested_items.description: An array of objects that describe the result of the action, such as the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the resources affected by the request.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the operation was initialized ( 1479816991.349).

nested_items.name: availabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone. Follows the format us-east-2a (case-sensitive).

nested_items.name: regionName
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region name.

nested_items.name: isTerminal
nested_items.description: A Boolean value indicating whether the operation is terminal.

nested_items.name: statusChangedAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the status was changed ( 1479816991.349).
